byline.original: By MEREDITH HOFFMAN and ROB HARRIS

abstract: About 400 protesters, including City Council members, crossed the Brooklyn Bridge to object to conduct by officers they consider racial profiling against black and Latino young people.
snippet: About 400 protesters, including City Council members, crossed the Brooklyn Bridge to object to conduct by officers they consider racial profiling against black and Latino young people.
lead_paragraph: With a chorus of plastic drumbeats, solidarity chants and fluttering flags, more than 400 protesters made a pilgrimage across the Brooklyn Bridge to City Hall Park in Manhattan.

headline.main: March on City Hall Calls for End to 'Stop and Frisk'
